result.execSummary:
The defendant Andre E Mozell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andre E Mozell

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Andre E Mozell in court with attorney Danielle Louise Shelton.  Defendant Andre E Mozell in custody.  May Y. Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LNR
On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Disorderly Conduct, contrary to Milwaukee County Ordinance 63.01. Defendant enters a plea of no contest. Court found the Defendant guilty. Court orders Defendant to pay a forfeiture of $50.00 inclusive of costs to be paid FORTHWITH. If the forfiture is not paid by today, defendant's sentence is to be 10 days in the House of Corrections, with Credit for 10 days time served. THIS IS A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION (if fine is not paid by today, 08/22/2016). Defendant has pending felony case before Judge Colon, 16CF1861. Due to the compeltion of this case, 15CM2474, the Defendant is to be extradited to Illinois. Case 16CF1861 is set for status before Judge Colon, Branch 18 on 09/08/2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Andre E Mozell in court with attorney Danielle Louise Shelton.  Defendant Andre E Mozell in custody.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for plea and sentencing hearing.  Plea hearing proceeded, but the state could not proceed because the victim in this case has not been notified.  Defense requests that the case remain calendared for jury trial.  Court ordered that the case remain calendared for jury trial in Branch 31.
Per defense counsel, case adjourned for plea and sentencing hearing on 8/17/16 at 8:30 am in Branch 4.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Received and filed.

Attorney Danielle Louise Shelton in court, defendant Andre E Mozell not in court, in custody.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Final pretrial held.  Case remains calendared for jury trial on August 22, 2016 at 8:30 am in Branch 4.  All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2016 this case will be assigned to Judge Hannah Dugan - Branch 31 in Room 622 - Courthouse.

Attorney Joel Alan Mogren in court, defendant Andre E Mozell not in court, in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for scheduling conference. Defendant not produced. Court waives his appearance.  Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial date. Case remains calendared in Branch 4  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 23, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 22, 2016 at 09:00 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with Delilah M
